resources.string: DetoxDroid has been paused for %d minutes.
This services disables and enables grayscale mode depending on which app is currently open. It also reacts to long-pressing the home button and manages detoxing mode pauses.
DetoxDroid needs specific permissions for this feature to work.

It might not be possible for you to uninstall DetoxDroid from the normal app manager, as you have granted particular permissions by installing it from your computer. Using this, you can revoke these permissions and uninstall DetoxDroid.\n\nIf you have apps deactivated right now through DetoxDroid, please make sure to re-activate them first.
Make \"Do Not Disturb\" your new default.
DetoxDroid will support you in winding down your smartphone use and curb with your smartphone addiction.
DetoxDroid automatically (re-)activates the do not disturb mode. Exceptions can be made with the system settings.
Color up by coloring down your phone

Apps compete for your attention, and colors can have an enticing, manipulative effect. With DetoxDroid, you can strip away all the neuron-stimulating colors, while allowing exceptions where necessary.
Your screen is now extra dim.
Non-fullscreen components (e.g. sound volume box, status bar) will be ignored, i.e. the color state will not be changed.
Take a break from taking a break

DetoxDroid can be paused for a defined period of time, for example if you want to take a quick look on a photo somebody sent you. A pause can be made by pressing the quick settings tile or by long-pressing the home button (not working on all devices).
Once the pause is over, DetoxDroid will automatically come back into life.
Don\'t cheat yourself by habitually pressing the pause button all the time.
Don\'t get lost in obsessive checking behaviors

EXPERIMENTAL â€“ Infinite scrolling is a manipulative design technology that eliminates those brief moments where you might turn to another activity. DetoxDroid can try to detect if you have been lost in such behavior and offer you an exit.
DetoxDroid will notify you if it detects that you have been "doom scrolling" for this duration.
Set up rules to define when to automatically (de-)activate DetoxDroid.
You can completely deactivate apps while DetoxDroid is active. Thereby, they cannot be started from the launcher nor can they send you notifications.
It appears you are caught in a loop of doom scrolling. What do you want to do?
For this feature, you need to grant this app elevated privileges from your computer via adb:
Don\'t worry, it takes you only a couple of minutes: Please visit https://detoxdroid.flx-apps.com/ to find out how.
Since your phone appears to be rooted, you can try to grant them by clicking on the button below. Otherwise, please visit https://detoxdroid.flx-apps.com/ to find out how.
